definition: responsible and diligent (idiom)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
office/duty
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
duty/responsibility/to reproach/to blame

sentences.english: Due diligence, the success rate of my near-perfect piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 盡職盡責中，成就了我一幅幅近乎完美的作品。

sentences.english: Very few politicians are doing their duty towards the country.
sentences.chinese: 能夠對本國盡職盡責的政治家實在不多。

sentences.english: The conscientious efforts of both sides during the past two years have been dedicated to the full and smooth implementation of the Joint Declaration.
sentences.chinese: 同時在過去的兩年裏各國都盡職盡責的執行聯合宣言。

sentences.english: I've had it easy, served up on all life's silver platters like a satrap.
sentences.chinese: 我已經很易於像總督一樣爲人們的溫飽盡職盡責。

definition: to tackle a thorny problem and overcome its challenges
industrious and hard-working/conscientious and meticulous
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
(to act) on one's own initiative
plethora of things to tackle/multitude of loose ends/very complicated/chaotic
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
night and day (idiom); continuous strenuous effort
selfless/impartial
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to concentrate on
where there's a start, there's a finish (idiom); to finish once one starts sth/to carry things through/I started, so I'll finish.
to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
young and vigorous (idiom)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
